Every New Year’s Eve I come back to this thought:  I don’t need another resolution. What I’m desperate for is a Revolution. ⁠
⁠
The word resolution is simply too small a word for all that’s on my heart as I prepare for another year. It lacks the power needed for continued transformation, sanctification, and lasting change. Resolutions are rooted in my resolve to do better. And I often fail at better. ⁠
⁠
No matter how hard I try to read the Bible more consistently, drink more water, say no to sweets, limit the amount of time I spend on Facebook, and increase the amount of time I spend on the treadmill… I rarely make it past January 10th transformed. ⁠
⁠
No, I don’t need another New Year’s resolution that will leave me unchanged. What I need is a revolution. Yes, that’s the word.  Revolution. ⁠
⁠
I don’t need another resolution… and I don’t need more resolve. What I need is more of Jesus. Not a resolution that I make, but a revolution that He makes… in me. Christ in me, revolting against me in this world. His power revolutionizing my weakness. His transforming purpose prevailing over all my plans in the new year. ⁠
⁠
What I need in 2024 is a total Jesus-revolution, way down deep in my fibers. Down in my habits too; my eating, my drinking, my shopping, and the time I spend on social media. I need Jesus’ strength revolting against all of the areas of my life where I’ve been too weak for far too long!⁠
⁠
If you haven’t signed up for the 2024 40-Day Sugar Fast yet, I hope that you will do that today. ⁠
⁠
Another New Year diet may change the way you eat temporarily, but fasting changes more than that — it changes your LIFE eternally! ⁠
⁠
Sign up now at 40daysugarfast.com and invite your friends to join us on this revolutionary journey at the start of a much-anticipated new year! ⁠
⁠
40daysugarfast.com⁠

Yesterday I posted a simple question: What is your “One Word” for 2024? ⁠
⁠
Choosing a word to guide us into the new year is a wonderful practice and I have loved doing this myself. However, two years ago I realized that there is ONE WORD that holds the answer to every other word we choose as our guiding question. ⁠
⁠
Year after year I hear from my online friends that they have chosen wonderful words like these: ⁠
⁠
JOY ⁠
HOPE⁠
SHINE⁠
PEACE⁠
COURAGE⁠
ENDURANCE⁠
FORGIVENESS… ⁠
⁠
While all of these are good and Godly themes, I’ve come to see that the best way to learn, understand, practice, and grow to embody each one is to search the Scriptures for guidance! All these themes are spoken of in God’s living, active, and oh-so-applicable Word. And so, once again, 𝐦𝐲 𝐎𝐍𝐄 𝐖𝐎𝐑𝐃 𝐢𝐬 𝐓𝐇𝐄 𝐖𝐎𝐑𝐃. ⁠
⁠
My Bible is the banner over every need and every area of my personal and Spiritual development. God speaks into every part of my life where I still need to grow up and mature. In every unrefined area that He longs to refine, His Word is the tool to get the job done! ⁠
⁠
In God’s Word, I find the path to peace: in His Holy Communication I hear His voice telling me where my ultimate hope can be found; in the Scriptures, I discover where pure JOY is too; and in my Bible, I find explanations on how to endure, as well as how to forgive and why.⁠
⁠
It’s all there! ⁠
⁠
While I love reading through my Bible from Genesis to Revelation, I also love searching the Scriptures for specific verses regarding a topic that I want to understand more fully and humbly apply to my life. ⁠
⁠
If you would like to download my free topical study guide and look up verses to encourage you on a particular struggle in your life, head on over to https://wendyspeake.com/40-day-feast/ and scroll down to find the free resource request. ⁠
⁠
This study guide was created as one of the free bonuses I gave away last January when I released The 40-Day Feast devotional.⁠

A FEW THOUGHTS:

The Word of God is the total weapon of warfare — both offensive and proactive, as well as defensive and reactive. 

We often think to wield it when the enemy strikes first, just like Jesus did in the dessert when the devil himself spoke tempting lies. Jesus struck back with the sword of the Spirit, the very word of God, and we can too

But the truth is, this is a weapon we can swing before the prowling enemy arrives. God’s Word is a saber to be savored when the sun is on the rise at the start of each new day. 

Before any enemy lie or scary circumstance strikes, we must strike first.
